file_purpose: Provide fast, deterministic feedback for changes to the orchestrator itself.
Enforce baseline quality gates *without* turning this repo into a distributable SaaS product.
functional_requirements: Must NOT require real provider API keys; all CI must run with mocks/fakes.
Must fail the PR on must-severity constraint violations for this repo (style/type/tests/security checks).
Must publish minimal artifacts (logs, coverage) to aid debugging.
must_include_items: Jobs for: lint/format, typecheck, unit tests, integration tests, smoke tests (mocked providers).
Schema validation for: orchestrator config, constraint registry, evidence ledger.
Caching for Python deps to keep runtime low on a single workstation CI runner.
nonfunctional_requirements: Keep runtime reasonable (target: < 10 minutes on GitHub-hosted runners).
Deterministic outputs (pin tool versions; avoid time-dependent snapshots unless fixed).
Avoid flaky tests; quarantine flakes immediately.
CI pipeline for the orchestrator repo itself

file_purpose: Catch secrets, vulnerable dependencies, and basic supply-chain issues early.
functional_requirements: Must run without privileged credentials.
Must treat newly introduced secrets as a hard failure.
Must treat critical/high vulns as a hard failure (configurable).
must_include_items: Secret scanning (patterns + entropy checks) with explicit allowlist for .env.example.
Dependency vulnerability scanning (pip-audit, osv-scanner, etc.) with pinned tool versions.
Optional SAST/lint rules for common Python security footguns.
License scanning (optional, depending on policy).
nonfunctional_requirements: Keep false positives manageable via documented allowlists.

file_purpose: Human-readable release notes for the orchestrator itself.
functional_requirements: Must record changes to on-disk schemas and config formats with migration guidance.
must_include_items: Adopt a changelog convention (Keep a Changelog or similar).
Track breaking changes, new features, fixes, and security updates.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must remain maintained; changes to public CLI/config require entries.

file_purpose: Contributor/agent guide: repo conventions, how to add constraints, how to add checkers, how to propose ADRs, and how to keep changes mergeable.
functional_requirements: Must give step-by-step instructions an agent can follow without needing tribal knowledge.
Must define the required evidence artifacts for changes to critical subsystems (security, sandbox, merge queue).
must_include_items: Repo philosophy: constraint-first, evidence-led, Git-native isolation.
How to run local verification suites and generate evidence artifacts.
How to add/modify constraints (files in constraints/registry/ + docs).
How to add a new checker plugin (verification_plane/checkers + docs/schemas).
How to add a new provider adapter (synthesis_plane/providers + config).
How to write ADRs (docs/adrs/) and when they are required.
Coding standards and security rules (no secrets, supply-chain policy).
Definition of Done for a work item implementation in this repo itself.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must be concise but unambiguous; prefer checklists.
Must be safe-by-default (explicitly forbid unsafe shortcuts like disabling gates).

file_purpose: Provide ergonomic shortcuts for the operator (you) and for agentic AIs running common tasks.
must_include_items: install, lint, typecheck, test (unit/integration/smoke), fmt, security-scan, clean, run, plan, status.
Targets should call underlying Python tooling, not contain complex logic.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must be safe to run repeatedly (idempotent).
Must not require network access except where explicitly documented (e.g., vuln DB updates).
Run `make help` to see available targets.

file_purpose: Top-level orientation for humans and for agentic AIs. Explains what NEXUS is, how to run it locally, and where to start implementing.
functional_requirements: Must make it obvious how an agent should proceed file-by-file to implement the orchestrator (point to docs/BUILD_ORDER.md).
Must define the expected user-facing workflows: ingest spec -> plan -> dispatch -> verify -> integrate -> audit.
Must define the minimal 'hello world' demo scenario (tiny repo, few work items) used by tests and smoke runs.
must_include_items: One-paragraph mission statement aligned to the design document (constraint-driven, Git-native, local-first).
Quick-start instructions (install deps, configure providers, run a demo orchestration).
Conceptual architecture map: planes/components and where to find them in the repo (link to docs/FILE_MAP.md).
Operating modes (greenfield/brownfield/hardening/exploration) and when to use each.
How constraints, evidence, and the merge queue work in practice.
Security posture + sandboxing overview and how to configure strictness.
Links to core docs: docs/design_document.md, docs/architecture/*.md, docs/runbooks/*.md, docs/schemas/*.md.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must remain accurate as the repo evolves (keep links/paths updated).
Must avoid provider-specific marketing language; treat providers as adapters.
Must be readable in under ~10 minutes; deeper details live in docs/.

file_purpose: Security policy and threat model summary for the orchestrator itself (not the projects it builds).
functional_requirements: Must document where secrets are allowed to exist (ideally nowhere in repo; use external secret manager).
Must define minimum security checks in the constraint gate for this repo (secret scanning, SCA).
must_include_items: Threat model summary (prompt injection, supply chain, secret leakage, sandbox escapes, malicious diffs).
Security boundaries: sandbox vs host, network egress policy, secrets handling.
Vulnerability reporting policy (even if private-only).
Secure development requirements: dependency scanning, pinned tools, reproducible builds.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must remain aligned with docs/threat_model.md and actual implementation.
Must avoid giving actionable instructions that weaken security without explicit warnings.

file_purpose: Explains how constraints are authored, stored, versioned, and loaded by the orchestrator.
functional_requirements: Must map directly to docs/schemas/CONSTRAINT_REGISTRY.md and the loader implementation.
must_include_items: Directory conventions: registry/, libraries/, checkers/ bindings.
Naming conventions for constraint IDs.
Override/exemption protocol (audited, rare).
How constraint evolution adds new constraints from failures.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must keep constraints readable and reviewable (avoid over-parameterized complexity).

file_purpose: Reusable constraint libraries (e.g., REST API, DB access, CLI, security baselines) that can be applied to projects.
functional_requirements: Must be loadable independently and composable with project constraints.
must_include_items: How libraries are structured and versioned.
How the planner selects libraries based on detected stack.
nonfunctional_requirements: Avoid overfitting; keep libraries generic and well-tested.

file_purpose: Defines the initial always-on constraints for the orchestrator *itself* and for orchestrated projects.
This file is intentionally small: it encodes the non-negotiables ("must") and a few "should" defaults.
functional_requirements: Must be machine-parseable (YAML) and validated via schema.
Must be versioned; changes require an ADR if semantics change.
must_include_items: Constraint records with unique IDs (e.g., CON-SEC-0001) and stable semantics over time.
Fields: id, severity (must/should/may), category, description, checker, parameters, requirement_links, source.
Clear mapping to checker implementations (verification_plane/checkers/*).
nonfunctional_requirements: Constraints must be deterministic and evidence-producing.
Keep false positives low; provide allowlists and parameters rather than disabling checks.
The entries below are *seed defaults* for bootstrapping. They are expected to evolve via the "Never Again" system.
Base constraints — always active, foundational rules
These are the minimum constraints for any orchestrator run.

file_purpose: Canonical architecture spec for the orchestrator. This is the 'single design document' that other agents will ingest.
functional_requirements: Must be parseable into a structured Spec Map (requirements, NFRs, entities, interfaces, acceptance criteria).
Must describe interfaces/contracts at a level sufficient to stabilize module boundaries early.
Must explicitly define the constraint gate policy and the exception/override protocol.
must_include_items: The unified NEXUS design: goals/non-goals, planes/components, data model (Artifact/Constraint/Evidence/WorkItem), Git coordination protocol, verification pipeline, sandboxing/security, resource governance, observability, operating modes, and roadmap.
Concrete definitions of 'perfect', 'constraint envelope', 'evidence ledger', 'merge queue', and 'constraint evolution'.
A stable requirement ledger section with unique IDs (REQ-0001...) and acceptance criteria that will feed the Spec Ingestor.
A glossary and cross-links to schemas in docs/schemas/.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must remain the single source of truth; other docs elaborate but do not contradict.
Must be updated via ADRs when major architectural choices change.

This repo skeleton ships with an abbreviated version of the agreed design text. Replace or expand this file by pasting the full agreed design document(s) from your prompt if desired. Keep the requirement IDs stable once established.

file_purpose: A prescriptive file-by-file implementation order for an agentic AI to build the orchestrator incrementally.
functional_requirements: Must define the MVP that can ingest a tiny spec, create work items, dispatch one agent, run one verifier, and commit evidence metadata.
Must define how to validate correctness at each phase (smoke tests and golden scenarios).
must_include_items: Phase-based build order aligned with the roadmap (MVP -> contracts -> sandbox -> adversarial -> evolution -> UI).
For each phase: required modules/files to implement, acceptance tests, and expected deliverables.
Explicit dependency ordering (e.g., domain model -> persistence -> git integration -> verification -> agent dispatch).
Minimal 'vertical slices' for early end-to-end functionality.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must minimize rework: stabilize formats and contracts early.

file_purpose: A map of the repo layout: which directory corresponds to which plane/component in the design doc, and where key schemas live.
functional_requirements: Must allow an agent to locate where to implement a given feature quickly.
must_include_items: One section per top-level directory explaining its purpose.
A per-plane mapping: control/synthesis/verification/integration/knowledge/sandbox/observability/ui.
Pointers to the file-by-file build order and to the design document sections that justify each directory.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must stay up to date; treat as high-signal index doc.

file_purpose: Defines canonical meanings of terms used across docs and code (Constraint Envelope, Evidence Ledger, Work Item, etc.).
functional_requirements: Must disambiguate overloaded terms like 'artifact' and 'contract'.
must_include_items: Alphabetical list of terms and concise definitions.
Cross-links to design_document.md and DATA_MODEL.md sections.
nonfunctional_requirements: Keep definitions stable; changes require ADR if meaning shifts.

file_purpose: Architecture Decision Record template. Used to record non-trivial architectural choices and tradeoffs.
functional_requirements: Must be used whenever public schemas/protocols change.
must_include_items: Title, status (proposed/accepted/superseded), context, decision, consequences.
Links to relevant requirements and constraints.
Migration/rollout plan if applicable.

file_purpose: Detailed data model specification (Artifact, Constraint, Evidence, WorkItem, TaskGraph, Tool, Sandbox, Run).
functional_requirements: Must be specific enough to implement persistent storage and APIs without guesswork.
must_include_items: Entity definitions and relationships (ERD-like description).
Field-level semantics, required/optional fields, and versioning rules.
IDs and traceability rules (requirement IDs, constraint IDs, evidence IDs).
Serialization formats and backwards-compat policy.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must avoid overfitting to one DB; support at least SQLite for local-first MVP.

file_purpose: Normative spec for Git workflows: branches, scopes, merge queue, conflict resolution, rollback, and metadata.
functional_requirements: Must define machine-checkable rules for scope violations (what is blocked vs escalated).
must_include_items: Branch naming conventions (main/integration/contract/*/work/*/verify/*).
Scope and file ownership rules and the exception protocol.
Merge queue algorithm and required checks for each risk tier.
Rollback and bisect policy when integration fails.

file_purpose: High-level architecture overview that complements design_document.md with repo-specific details (paths, module boundaries, and diagrams).
functional_requirements: Must define the orchestrator’s 'critical invariants' in one place (no merge without evidence, scope enforcement, etc.).
must_include_items: A clear explanation of the 5 planes and their responsibilities.
A request/response-style walkthrough of a single work item lifecycle.
Data flow: Spec -> SpecMap -> TaskGraph -> Dispatch -> Patch -> Verify -> Evidence -> Merge.
Explicit serialized points (merge queue) vs parallel points (agent dispatch).
nonfunctional_requirements: Must be stable enough to serve as onboarding for new agents.

file_purpose: Normative spec for the constraint gate: stages, evidence artifacts, incremental vs full verification, and risk-tier policy.
functional_requirements: Must define how checkers are registered and how constraints map to checkers.
must_include_items: Stage taxonomy (build, lint, typecheck, unit, integration, security scan, perf).
Evidence format and required metadata (tool versions, hashes, environment).
Adversarial tests: when and how they run; separation of concerns.
Flaky test detection and quarantine protocol.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must be reproducible; avoid nondeterminism or record it explicitly as evidence.

file_purpose: Defines agent roles (Architect, Implementer, Reviewer, Security, Performance, Toolsmith, Integrator, Constraint Miner, Doc agent) and their tool permissions.
functional_requirements: Must align with synthesis_plane/roles.py and provider routing implementation.
must_include_items: Role definitions: goals, allowed tools/capabilities, budgets, success criteria.
Default routing policy (Codex vs Claude class) and escalation ladder.
Prompt injection defenses and context hygiene rules for role prompts.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must avoid embedding secrets; prompts should be deterministic templates with placeholders.

file_purpose: Role prompt template used by the orchestrator’s Context Assembler and Dispatch Controller.
functional_requirements: Must be self-contained and deterministic: avoid open-ended phrasing that causes variable outputs.
Must instruct the agent to output ONLY the required format (no extra prose) where feasible.
must_include_items: Strict placeholders (machine substitutable) for: Spec Map excerpts, contracts, constraints, scope, budgets, tool access.
A machine-parseable output format (JSON/YAML) for agent outputs.
Explicit safety / sandbox rules to prevent prompt injection and tool abuse.
nonfunctional_requirements: Template should be optimized for a private single-operator workflow (no multi-tenant language).

file_purpose: Template prompt for the Architect role.
functional_requirements: Must produce outputs the Spec Ingestor/Constraint Compiler can parse deterministically.
must_include_items: Instruction to produce module graph, interface contracts, work item decomposition, and ADRs.
Explicit deliverable format (machine-parseable sections) without code blocks.
Checklist of invariants: no gaps in requirement coverage, non-overlapping ownership, contracts-first sequencing.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must be robust to prompt injection via spec text; include instructions to ignore untrusted repo content.

file_purpose: Role prompt template used by the orchestrator’s Context Assembler and Dispatch Controller.
functional_requirements: Must be self-contained and deterministic: avoid open-ended phrasing that causes variable outputs.
Must instruct the agent to output ONLY the required format (no extra prose) where feasible.
must_include_items: Strict placeholders (machine substitutable) for: Spec Map excerpts, contracts, constraints, scope, budgets, tool access.

file_purpose: Template prompt for the Implementer role (writes code within scope).
functional_requirements: Must instruct implementers to produce deterministic changes and avoid touching out-of-scope files.
must_include_items: Scope restrictions and enforcement reminders.
Deliverables: patch, tests, rationale, and 'self-check' evidence summary.
Guidance on tool usage inside sandbox and reproducibility.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must encode safety boundaries: no disabling checks, no secrets, no obfuscation.

file_purpose: Template prompt for adversarial Reviewer role.
functional_requirements: Must be able to run without seeing implementer rationale to reduce bias.
must_include_items: Adversarial review checklist: edge cases, error paths, concurrency hazards, security smells, performance hotspots.
Deliverables: issues list mapped to constraints/requirements; suggested tests (no implementation).
nonfunctional_requirements: Must focus on actionable, verifiable findings.

file_purpose: Role prompt template used by the orchestrator’s Context Assembler and Dispatch Controller.
functional_requirements: Must be self-contained and deterministic: avoid open-ended phrasing that causes variable outputs.

file_purpose: Defines formatting/linting/typecheck standards for the orchestrator repo itself.
functional_requirements: Must map to constraint records in constraints/registry/.
must_include_items: Chosen tools and their versions (once selected).
Rules that reduce merge conflicts (format on save, import ordering).
How style constraints are enforced by CI and local gate.

file_purpose: Step-by-step runbook for running the orchestrator on a local workstation.
functional_requirements: Must define how to run in offline mode (no providers) for smoke tests.
must_include_items: Pre-reqs (Python, container runtime, Git).
Initial config: providers, budgets, sandbox strictness, paths.
Running a demo: ingest sample spec, plan, dispatch, verify, integrate.
How to inspect state, evidence, logs, and dashboards (TUI).
Common failure triage and how to recover.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must be copy/paste friendly when code exists; for now, descriptive.

file_purpose: Operational guidance: resource tuning, backpressure, caches, and managing long runs.
functional_requirements: Must describe how to safely stop/resume runs without corrupting state.
must_include_items: Resource governor knobs and recommended defaults for the given hardware envelope.
How to tune verification concurrency vs agent dispatch concurrency.
Disk cleanup policies and evidence retention settings.
Cost controls: budgets, speculative execution toggles.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must prioritize not destabilizing the workstation.

file_purpose: Config schema documentation: keys, types, defaults, and examples (non-code).
functional_requirements: Must match config/schema.py validation rules.
must_include_items: Config sections: providers, routing, budgets, resource governor, sandbox, git, observability, UI.
Versioning and migration guidance.
nonfunctional_requirements: Avoid provider-specific coupling; keep adapters abstract.

file_purpose: Schema/spec for constraints: how constraints are authored, versioned, and mapped to checkers.
functional_requirements: Must be specific enough to implement serialization + validation + registry queries.
must_include_items: Constraint fields (id, severity, description, category, associated requirements, checker binding, parameters, exemptions).
How constraints evolve and how to prevent regressions.
How to represent project-specific vs reusable constraint libraries.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must support backward compatibility via schema versions.

file_purpose: Schema/spec for evidence artifacts and how they link to constraints/work items/commits.
functional_requirements: Must enable answering: requirement -> constraint -> evidence -> commit.
must_include_items: Evidence types (logs, reports, coverage, benchmarks, SBOM, dependency audit).
Required metadata: run ID, timestamps, tool versions, hashes, environment, file paths.
Retention policy guidance and redaction rules.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must be append-only and tamper-evident where feasible.

file_purpose: Persistent state schema (SQLite-first) for runs, work items, attempts, merges, and queue state.
functional_requirements: Must support safe resume after crash and idempotent operations.
must_include_items: Tables/collections: projects, runs, work_items, task_graph_edges, constraints, evidence_refs, provider_calls, tool_installs, sandboxes, merges, incidents.
Indexing strategy for performance on a single machine.
Migration/versioning strategy.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must remain fast and small; avoid unbounded growth without retention policies.

file_purpose: Machine-readable schema for orchestrator.toml after it is normalized to JSON for validation.
Requirements:
JSON Schema draft selection must be recorded (ADR).
Include schemaVersion field and backwards compatibility policy.
Keep comments to explain tricky fields; keep the schema strict.
NOTE:
This skeleton intentionally omits the actual schema to avoid pseudo-code; add fields when implementing.
Machine-readable schema for constraints/registry/*.yaml entries after YAML->JSON normalization.
must_include_items: Definitions for Constraint, Severity, Category, CheckerBinding, Parameters, Requirement links.
Validation rules: id format, uniqueness, allowed categories, severity enums, required fields.
Support for future extension fields with explicit versioning.
NOTE
This schema is intentionally minimal in the skeleton. Fill it in during implementation.
Keep schemas strict; prefer explicit enums and 'additionalProperties: false'.

file_purpose: Machine-readable schema for evidence ledger entries recorded per work item and per merge.
must_include_items: Definitions for EvidenceRecord, CheckRun, ArtifactHashes, ToolVersions, Environment capture.
Invariants: required timestamps, stable IDs, hash algorithms allowed, retention policy metadata.
NOTE
This schema is intentionally minimal in the skeleton. Fill it in during implementation.
Keep schemas strict; prefer explicit enums and 'additionalProperties: false'.

file_purpose: Schema for the normalized Spec Map produced by Spec Ingestor (requirements ledger + extracted entities).
must_include_items: Definitions for Requirement, AcceptanceCriteria, NonFunctionalRequirement, Entities, Interfaces, Risks.
NOTE
This schema is intentionally minimal in the skeleton. Fill it in during implementation.
Keep schemas strict; prefer explicit enums and 'additionalProperties: false'.

file_purpose: Schema for the planned task graph (work items DAG) emitted by Architect Agent + Constraint Compiler.
must_include_items: Definitions for WorkItem, Scope, ConstraintEnvelope, Dependencies, Budgets, RiskTier, ExpectedArtifacts.
NOTE
This schema is intentionally minimal in the skeleton. Fill it in during implementation.
Keep schemas strict; prefer explicit enums and 'additionalProperties: false'.

file_purpose: Full threat model for the orchestrator and its sandboxes.
functional_requirements: Must define enforceable controls (config flags + default policies) rather than vague guidance.
must_include_items: Assets, actors, trust boundaries.
Abuse cases: prompt injection via repo, malicious dependency installation, data exfiltration, sandbox escape, credential leakage, covert channels via logs.
Mitigations: capability-based permissions, content hygiene, network egress controls, tool allowlists, provenance logs.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must match the implemented sandbox and logging behavior; keep updated as controls change.

file_purpose: Single source of configuration for local runs: providers, routing, budgets, resources, sandbox policy, paths, and UI.
functional_requirements: MUST NOT contain secrets; only env var names.
Must support profile overrides (e.g., exploration vs hardening).
must_include_items: Provider configs (OpenAI/Anthropic/local) referencing environment variables for secrets.
Routing policies: which role/task goes to which model/provider; escalation ladder.
Resource governor thresholds matching your hardware envelope (CPU/RAM/Disk/GPU).
Verification policies (risk tiers → required stages).
Git coordination settings (branch prefixes, merge queue rules).
Personalization profile settings (your house rules, preferred stack, dependency policy).
nonfunctional_requirements: Be human-editable and easy for agents to parse.
This is the single source of config. Env vars override with NEXUS_ prefix.
Secrets are NEVER stored here — reference env var names only.

file_purpose: Define the orchestrator as a local, developer-run tool.
Centralize dependency groups and tool configuration for reproducible development.
functional_requirements: Must support editable installs (`pip install -e .`) for rapid local iteration.
Must separate provider deps to allow running without vendor SDKs (mock mode).
must_include_items: Minimal core dependencies for the orchestrator runtime.
Optional extras for providers (OpenAI/Anthropic), sandboxing (docker), and UI (TUI).
Dev tooling: formatter, linter, type checker, test runner, coverage, security scanners.
Entry point for CLI (e.g., `nexus`).
nonfunctional_requirements: Prefer fewer dependencies; this is a private tool, not a platform.
Pin or constrain versions to avoid silent breaking changes.

file_purpose: Generate an API cost report per run/work item/provider from state DB records.
functional_requirements: Must attribute costs to work items and phases.
Must export as CSV/JSON.
Must support filtering by provider/model.
must_include_items: python scripts/cost_report.py --db state/nexus.sqlite --since 2026-01-01

file_purpose: Export an 'audit bundle' containing evidence, constraints, ADRs, and key logs for a given run/commit range.
functional_requirements: Must include constraint registry snapshot, evidence ledger entries, and referenced artifacts.
Must compute hashes for integrity.
Must redact secrets.
must_include_items: python scripts/export_audit.py --run-id RUN123 --out audit_bundle.zip
nonfunctional_requirements: Avoid copying massive ephemeral caches; be size-conscious.

file_purpose: Garbage-collect old workspaces/build artifacts to reclaim disk.
functional_requirements: Must delete only safe-to-delete workspaces (not active).
Must respect retention policy.
Must support dry-run.
must_include_items: python scripts/gc_workspaces.py --workspace-root workspaces/ --dry-run
nonfunctional_requirements: Safe and conservative; prefer leaving files over deleting wrongly.

file_purpose: Apply SQLite migrations for the state DB.
functional_requirements: Must apply migrations in order, idempotently.
Must record migration versions and checksums.
Must support dry-run and status output.
must_include_items: python scripts/migrate_db.py --db state/nexus.sqlite
python scripts/migrate_db.py --dry-run

file_purpose: Provide a stable, WSL-friendly entrypoint for repository blueprint generation and validation.
functional_requirements: Must run without installation by resolving `src/` on `sys.path`.
Must delegate to `nexus_orchestrator.repo_blueprint` without changing semantics.
must_include_items: python scripts/repo_audit.py --summary --validate
python scripts/repo_audit.py --print-phase-map
python scripts/repo_audit.py --json
python scripts/repo_audit.py --write-artifacts --validate --fail-on-warn

file_purpose: Verify integrity of evidence artifacts using stored hashes and tool version metadata.
functional_requirements: Must re-hash artifacts and compare against ledger.
Must report missing/corrupt artifacts.
Must produce machine-readable report (JSON).
must_include_items: python scripts/verify_evidence.py --run-id RUN123
python scripts/verify_evidence.py --path evidence/

file_purpose: Package root. Defines public package-level metadata and import boundaries.
functional_requirements: Must not have side effects at import time (no config loading, no logging init).
must_include_items: Package docstring describing NEXUS orchestrator at a high level.
Version export and minimal public API surface (keep small).
Import boundary rules: avoid importing heavy submodules at import time.
__all__ definition for public symbols (once implementation exists)
nonfunctional_requirements: Must keep import time fast (<100ms typical).

file_purpose: Config package: parsing, validation, profiles, defaults, and schema versioning.
functional_requirements: Must support loading from orchestrator.toml + env var overrides.
must_include_items: Public config types and loader function docs.
Boundary: no provider calls here.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must provide clear error messages; fail fast on invalid config.

file_purpose: Loads runtime configuration from TOML + env vars and applies profile defaults.
functional_requirements: Must ensure secrets are referenced, not embedded (e.g., env var names).
Must support dumping an effective config with secrets redacted.
must_include_items: Search paths and precedence rules (CLI flag -> env -> local file -> defaults).
Environment variable mapping (NEXUS_ prefix).
Config normalization (paths expanded, durations parsed).
nonfunctional_requirements: Must be deterministic; avoid 'magic' host-dependent defaults that break reproducibility.

file_purpose: Defines the authoritative config schema and validation rules.
functional_requirements: Must validate config file and return structured error report (field path, error).
Must support 'profiles' (strict/permissive/hardening/exploration).
must_include_items: Schema versioning and migration strategy.
Validation rules: required fields, types, constraints (ranges).
Redaction rules for sensitive fields (ensure secrets never appear in logs).
ConfigSchemaVersion constant and validator entrypoint (implementation later).
nonfunctional_requirements: Schema changes must be backwards compatible or provide migration guidance.

file_purpose: Central place for stable constants: default branch names, directory names, schema versions, etc.
functional_requirements: Must be imported safely without heavy deps.
must_include_items: Default branch names (main/integration/contract/work/verify).
Schema version numbers for config/registry/evidence/state DB.
Default paths for caches (overridable via config).
Risk tier names and default mappings.
nonfunctional_requirements: Changing a constant that affects on-disk formats must be treated as a breaking change and recorded in CHANGELOG.

file_purpose: Control plane package: run state machine, scheduler, budgets, and adaptive feedback loops.
functional_requirements: Must coordinate the planes without tight coupling.
must_include_items: High-level control abstractions: OrchestratorController, RunCoordinator.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must remain testable with mocked subcomponents.

file_purpose: Budget enforcement: token/cost per work item, per role, per run; iteration caps; wall-clock caps.
functional_requirements: Must prevent runaway loops (infinite retries).
must_include_items: Budget accounting model and attribution (work item -> attempts -> provider calls).
Escalation rules when budget is exceeded (switch provider, reduce context, or halt).
nonfunctional_requirements: Must be transparent: all budget decisions logged with reasons.

file_purpose: Top-level controller coordinating a run: planning, dispatch, verification, merge, and re-planning.
functional_requirements: Must support pause/resume/cancel operations.
Must support re-planning when integration failures or constraint contradictions occur.
invariants: Verification pool saturated: apply backpressure, not OOM.
Merge conflicts: dispatch integrator or trigger re-plan.
must_include_items: Run lifecycle state machine and transitions.
Event emission for observability at each step.
Backpressure integration: throttle dispatch when verification is saturated.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must be resilient to crashes; transitions must be persisted atomically.

file_purpose: Feedback Synthesizer: distills verification failures into structured actionable packages for agent retries and for constraint mining.
functional_requirements: Must produce machine-readable feedback objects stored in state DB and shown in UI.
must_include_items: Mapping failing checks -> violated constraints -> fix suggestions.
Attach minimal reproduction artifacts (paths to logs, failing tests).
Pattern matching against prior failures to speed iteration.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must redact secrets and minimize leaking sensitive data into prompts.

file_purpose: Selects which work items to run next, maximizing parallelism while respecting dependencies, scopes, risk, and resource limits.
functional_requirements: Must compute dispatch decisions using state DB queries (not in-memory full scans only).
Must respect API cost budgets and per-role iteration limits.
invariants: Deterministic scheduling tests with fixed graphs and budgets.
Stress test with 1000 work items and random dependencies.
must_include_items: Scheduling algorithm (critical-path first; adapt based on failure history).
Speculative execution policy controls (optional).
Risk-tier-based throttling (e.g., only 1 critical merge candidate at a time).
Fairness policy to avoid starving long-tail items.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must remain fast; scheduling should not become the bottleneck.

file_purpose: Domain types shared across planes: WorkItem, Constraint, Evidence, Run, Artifact, ToolRequest, etc.
functional_requirements: Domain objects must be serializable and versioned.
must_include_items: Re-export of core domain entities for convenience.
Keep domain layer free of IO side effects.
nonfunctional_requirements: Domain layer should have minimal dependencies.

file_purpose: Event model for internal observability and for state transitions (run started, work item dispatched, verification failed, merge succeeded, etc.).
functional_requirements: Must enable building a live dashboard/TUI from event stream.
must_include_items: Event types and payload shape guidelines.
Correlation IDs for tracing across planes.
Rules for redacting sensitive data from events.
nonfunctional_requirements: Events must be lightweight and safe to persist.

file_purpose: Defines canonical ID formats and helpers (requirement IDs, constraint IDs, work item IDs, run IDs).
functional_requirements: Must validate IDs and reject malformed ones early.
must_include_items: ID naming conventions and validation rules.
Collision avoidance strategy (UUIDv7, ULID, etc.).
Human-friendly short IDs for UI.
nonfunctional_requirements: IDs must be stable across restarts and persisted.

file_purpose: Core data structures for orchestration (no persistence logic).
functional_requirements: Must be explicit about required vs optional fields, and defaults.
Must support schema versioning for serialized forms.
invariants: Round-trip serialization tests for each model version.
Validation tests for required fields and invariants.
must_include_items: Definitions for: Requirement, SpecMap, WorkItem, TaskGraph, Constraint, ConstraintEnvelope, EvidenceRecord, Artifact, Attempt, MergeRecord, Incident.
Fields for traceability: links between requirements, constraints, evidence, commits.
Risk tiering model and severity enums.
Policy objects: budgets, resource limits, sandbox policies.
nonfunctional_requirements: Keep models small; avoid embedding large blobs (store references to on-disk artifacts instead).

file_purpose: Explains extension points: provider adapters, checkers, UI plugins, constraint libraries.
functional_requirements: Must document how to add a plugin without editing core modules.
must_include_items: Stable plugin APIs and versioning rules.
How plugins are discovered and loaded (config + entrypoints).
Security considerations: plugins are code; treat as trusted only when reviewed.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must keep plugin system simple for a single-user tool.

file_purpose: Integration plane: Git operations, workspace management, merge queue, conflict resolution, rollback.
functional_requirements: Must serialize merges and enforce scope/ownership.
must_include_items: Public interfaces for creating branches, applying patches, and merging with evidence metadata.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must be robust to conflicts and partial failures.

file_purpose: Automated and agent-assisted conflict resolution protocols.
functional_requirements: Must avoid 'creative' auto-merges that violate constraints.
must_include_items: Trivial conflict auto-resolvers (formatting/import ordering) policy.
Integrator role dispatch for non-trivial conflicts.
Protocol for when conflicts imply contract drift requiring re-plan.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must log and surface all conflict resolutions for audit.

file_purpose: Wraps Git operations (init, clone, branch, rebase, merge, revert, diff) with safety checks and audit metadata.
functional_requirements: Must never allow direct commits to integration/main from agent workspaces (always through orchestrator).
Must support dry-run merges to detect conflicts early.
must_include_items: Abstraction over Git CLI/library with deterministic behavior.
Hooks to attach commit metadata (work item ID, evidence refs).
Path-based scope enforcement (block out-of-scope changes).
nonfunctional_requirements: Must be fast; use shallow operations where possible.

file_purpose: Serialized merge queue logic: rebase onto integration, run compositional checks, merge or revert, update state.
functional_requirements: Must guarantee only one merge in flight at a time.
Must record merge decisions with evidence references in state DB.
must_include_items: Queue ordering (by readiness, risk tier, dependencies).
Compositional check policy (fast subset + full integration where required).
Rollback on failure and bisect triggers.

file_purpose: Creates isolated per-work-item workspaces (branches + filesystem dirs), applies patches, and manages cleanup.
functional_requirements: Must support concurrent workspaces for parallel agent attempts.
must_include_items: Workspace lifecycle: create -> populate -> hand to sandbox -> collect outputs -> cleanup.
Ownership map enforcement (allowed paths).
GC policy and safety checks.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must keep disk usage bounded; garbage collect aggressively.

file_purpose: Knowledge plane: indexing, retrieval, constraint registry, evidence ledger access, personalization memory, and failure pattern mining.
functional_requirements: Must serve context assembler and scheduler decisions.
must_include_items: Interfaces to query codebase knowledge and historical runs.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must be incremental and lightweight on a single machine.

file_purpose: Loads, validates, and queries the Constraint Registry stored under constraints/.
functional_requirements: Must provide envelopes to planning/verification.
must_include_items: Registry loader and schema validation.
Query APIs: by ID, by category, by severity, by requirement link.
Override/exemption tracking and audit record integration.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must support schema versioning and migration.

file_purpose: Read/write interface to the Evidence Ledger; links evidence artifacts to constraints and commits.
functional_requirements: Must answer traceability queries efficiently.
must_include_items: Ledger record model and query APIs.
Export utilities for audit bundles.
Integrity checks (hashes, missing artifacts).
nonfunctional_requirements: Should be append-only; avoid mutating historical evidence.

file_purpose: Constraint evolution engine: mines failures and proposes new constraints/tests/checkers ('never again' pipeline).
functional_requirements: Must write proposed constraints into constraints/registry with provenance metadata.
must_include_items: Failure classification taxonomy (bug, spec gap, flake, perf regression, security finding).
Rules to generate new constraints or regression tests.
Human-in-the-loop controls (auto-accept vs review).
nonfunctional_requirements: Must avoid exploding constraint set with low-signal rules; include deduplication and review queues.

file_purpose: Indexes the repository for retrieval: file catalog, symbol map, dependency graph hints, and optional semantic embeddings.
functional_requirements: Must support 'give me all files relevant to module X / interface Y'.
must_include_items: Incremental indexing strategy (watch git commits).
Extraction of dependency info (imports) per supported language stacks.
Optional semantic index behind a feature flag (GPU optional).
nonfunctional_requirements: Must not exceed memory budgets; store indexes on disk.

file_purpose: Personalization memory: stores user preferences as constraints/heuristics (preferred stacks, style rules, dependency policy).
functional_requirements: Must allow turning off personalization for reproducible baseline runs.
must_include_items: Representation of preferences as data (not hidden prompts).
How preferences influence planning and routing.
Import/export of a 'profile' for reuse across projects.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must keep private data local and avoid sending it to providers unless necessary and redacted.

file_purpose: Retrieval API for context assembly: dependency-based, keyword-based, and optional semantic retrieval.
functional_requirements: Must support token-budgeted context bundles.
must_include_items: Ranking policy: contracts first, then direct deps, then similar modules, then recent changes.
Safety filters: exclude suspicious content that resembles prompt injection.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must be deterministic given the same index snapshot.

file_purpose: Primary executable entrypoint (invoked by CLI). Orchestrates high-level run lifecycle: load config, open state, start run, dispatch pipeline, exit codes.
functional_requirements: Must support running in offline/mock mode for CI and samples.
Must produce deterministic exit codes per failure category (config error, verification failure, provider failure, internal bug).
invariants: Workspace root missing or not writable.
Unexpected exceptions: must be recorded as incidents in state and surfaced in UI.
Smoke test: run with samples/specs/minimal_design_doc.md and mocked providers.
Crash/restart test: kill mid-run and resume.
must_include_items: Run bootstrap sequence: config -> logging -> state -> repositories -> controllers.
Command routing to subcommands (plan, run, verify, status, export).
Graceful shutdown and resume support hooks.
Application 'run context' object passed to subsystems (logger, state, config, paths).
nonfunctional_requirements: Must support interrupt handling (Ctrl+C) without corrupting state.

file_purpose: Operating modes: greenfield, brownfield, hardening, exploration.
Brownfield mode — repository already exists.
functional_requirements: Indexer scans existing code, infers module boundaries, maps existing tests.
Constraint Registry built incrementally from existing enforcement (lint rules, CI checks).
Work items focus on safe refactoring, adding constraint coverage, new features.
Architect Agent proposes boundary adjustments and interface stabilization.
Extra care: preserve existing functionality (regression tests mandatory).

file_purpose: Exploration mode — parallel candidate evaluation.
functional_requirements: For ambiguous requirements, dispatch multiple agents with different strategies.
Each candidate independently verified against constraint gate.
Best candidate selected (or tradeoffs presented to operator).
Only the selected candidate merges. Others are discarded with evidence preserved.

file_purpose: Greenfield mode — repository starts empty.
functional_requirements: Architect Agent produces full decomposition from scratch.
Phase 2 (foundation) scaffolds project structure, build system, CI, types.
Full parallel build follows standard pipeline.
All interface contracts created fresh.

file_purpose: Hardening mode — strengthen existing codebase.
functional_requirements: Primarily dispatches Test Engineer, Security, Performance, and Constraint Miner roles.
Focus: add tests, security checks, performance budgets, eliminate tech debt.
Used before releases, after incidents, or when quality metrics drop.
May not produce new features — only quality improvements.

file_purpose: Observability primitives: structured logging, metrics, tracing, and event stream.
functional_requirements: Must support a local TUI/dashboard reading live run status.
must_include_items: Logger setup, event bus, metrics registry interfaces.

file_purpose: Event bus implementation for internal pub/sub between components and for UI updates.
functional_requirements: Must support replaying event history for UI after restart.
must_include_items: Event publishing API and subscription model.
Persistence of key events to state DB for post-hoc analysis.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must be resilient and not lose critical events.

file_purpose: Structured logging setup and redaction helpers.
functional_requirements: Must support per-run log directories and log-level overrides.
must_include_items: Log format (JSON preferred) and correlation IDs.
Redaction pipeline for secrets and provider transcripts.
Log sinks (stdout, file, rotating).
nonfunctional_requirements: Must be fast; avoid blocking IO on hot paths.

file_purpose: Metrics model and collection for run KPIs (acceptance rate, iterations, merge failures, resource usage).
functional_requirements: Must power scheduler adaptation and dashboard display.
must_include_items: Metric definitions and aggregation windows.
Export formats (prometheus-style optional; local JSON default).

file_purpose: Persistence layer: state DB access, migrations, repositories/DAOs.
functional_requirements: Must support safe resume after crash and concurrent readers.
must_include_items: DB connection management and transaction boundaries.
Repository classes for domain objects.
Migration runner and schema version checks.

file_purpose: Repository/DAO interfaces for reading/writing domain entities to the state DB.
functional_requirements: Must provide atomic updates for state transitions (e.g., work item status changes).
Must support append-only evidence recording semantics.
must_include_items: Repositories: RunRepo, WorkItemRepo, ConstraintRepo, EvidenceRepo, MergeRepo, ToolRepo, ProviderCallRepo.
Query patterns needed by scheduler and UI (e.g., next runnable work items).
Pagination and indexing considerations.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must be efficient; avoid loading entire run history into memory.

file_purpose: SQLite schema management, migrations, and connection lifecycle.
functional_requirements: Must support idempotent migration application.
Must record run metadata and incidents even on failure.
must_include_items: Schema version table and migration runner design.
Safe locking strategy and busy timeout handling.
Backup/restore helpers (export).
nonfunctional_requirements: Must avoid long-lived locks that block UI/status commands.

file_purpose: Planning layer: decomposition, constraint compilation, task graph generation, and re-planning.
functional_requirements: Must output a valid DAG of work items and constraints.
must_include_items: Planner entrypoints and high-level orchestration between architect agent and deterministic compiler.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must produce repeatable plans given same spec/config (within nondeterminism constraints).

file_purpose: Defines how the Architect Agent communicates its decomposition to the orchestrator.
functional_requirements: Must be strict: reject outputs that lack coverage or violate ownership rules.
must_include_items: Expected structured output format (machine-parseable) for: module graph, interface contracts, work items, ADR suggestions.
Validation rules before accepting architect output.
nonfunctional_requirements: Format must be easy for LLMs to follow reliably.

file_purpose: Deterministically validates and compiles constraints into envelopes per work item, including propagation through dependencies.
functional_requirements: Must guarantee that every work item has a complete constraint envelope.
Must detect cycles and unresolved dependencies.
invariants: Property tests: random DAGs with constraints; ensure propagation and cycle detection.
must_include_items: Validation of DAG, ownership uniqueness, contract stabilization rules.
Constraint propagation logic (interface guarantees become caller constraints).
Conflict detection (unsatisfiable envelopes) and escalation pathway.
Outputs for scheduler: runnable sets, critical path metrics.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must be fast enough to re-run frequently (incremental updates).

file_purpose: Represents and manipulates the task graph (DAG) of work items.
functional_requirements: Must support retrieving 'next runnable' work items efficiently.
must_include_items: Graph operations: add/remove nodes, topo sort, critical path estimation, dependency queries.
Serialization for persistence in state DB.
Support for re-planning: patching graph while preserving completed work.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must handle hundreds to thousands of work items without heavy memory usage.

file_purpose: Build a deterministic, machine-readable repository blueprint used as a quality contract.
functional_requirements: Must run offline and produce deterministic output for unchanged repository state.
Must expose validation checks that are hard to cheat across independent sources.
Must support WSL-friendly execution (`python scripts/repo_audit.py ...`).
must_include_items: Tracked-file discovery with git-first and deterministic filesystem fallback.
Header extraction/parser utilities for Python, Markdown/HTML comments, and comment-prefixed files.
Phase/plane inference, cross-reference indexing, placeholder scanning, and validation checks.
CLI helpers to print summaries, emit JSON, and write generated docs artifacts.
nonfunctional_requirements: Keep runtime low for local iteration (<20s typical on this repository).
Never require provider SDKs or network access.

file_purpose: Sandbox execution environment for tools, checkers, and agent-invoked commands.
functional_requirements: Must enforce filesystem scoping and resource limits.
must_include_items: SandboxManager, ToolProvisioner, ResourceGovernor interfaces.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must be secure-by-default with configurable strictness.

file_purpose: Defines network egress policies for sandboxes and tool provisioning (strict, allowlist, logged permissive).
functional_requirements: Must support turning off network completely for offline tests.
must_include_items: Policy model and enforcement hooks for sandbox backend.
Logging requirements: record domain/IP, bytes, timing (as allowed).
nonfunctional_requirements: Must default to safe; permissive mode must be explicit and logged.

file_purpose: Monitors and enforces local resource budgets; provides backpressure signals to scheduler/verification.
functional_requirements: Must prevent OOM and swapping by throttling early.
must_include_items: Metrics collection (CPU/RAM/disk/IO) and thresholds.
Concurrency tokens for verification jobs.
Graceful degradation policy (disable speculative exec, reduce concurrency, shrink caches).
nonfunctional_requirements: Must have low overhead; avoid heavy monitoring agents.

file_purpose: Creates and manages sandbox environments (containers or OS-level sandboxes).
functional_requirements: Must provide a unified API regardless of sandbox backend (Docker/Podman/etc.).
must_include_items: Sandbox lifecycle: create -> exec -> capture outputs -> destroy.
Filesystem mount policy (workspace RW, caches RO, secrets none).
Network policy modes (off, allowlist, logged permissive).
Resource limits (CPU/mem) and timeouts.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must prevent sandbox escape and host filesystem access beyond mounts.

file_purpose: Installs and manages toolchains used by agents and checkers inside sandbox environments.
functional_requirements: Must support on-demand tool installation for maximum agent autonomy (within policy).
must_include_items: Tool registry (known tools, versions, checksums, licenses).
Installation strategies (language package managers, OS packages) with pinning.
Vulnerability scanning hooks (SCA) before tools are approved.
Provenance records written to state DB + evidence.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must ensure reproducibility: every tool version used recorded in evidence.

file_purpose: Security utilities: secret scanning hooks, prompt injection defenses, provenance tracking.
functional_requirements: Must provide consistent redaction and scanning utilities.
must_include_items: Helpers used across planes to enforce safety boundaries.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must fail closed for critical safety checks (configurable exceptions require audit).

file_purpose: Prompt injection defenses and context sanitization for feeding repo content/specs into LLMs.
functional_requirements: Must be applied by context assembler and prompt rendering.
must_include_items: Heuristics to detect instruction-like content in repo files and demote/exclude it.
Delimiting and quoting strategy for untrusted content.
Policy: which files are trusted (templates, schemas) vs untrusted (generated code).
nonfunctional_requirements: Must be transparent (log when content is excluded, with rationale).

file_purpose: Implements redaction rules for logs, evidence, and provider transcripts.
functional_requirements: Must ensure no secrets leak into prompts/logs by default.
must_include_items: Secret patterns and configurable allowlists/denylists.
Deterministic redaction transforms and tests.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must minimize false positives while prioritizing safety.

file_purpose: Spec ingestion plane: transforms input design docs into a normalized Spec Map used by planning.
functional_requirements: Must produce a SpecMap that covers all requirements with IDs and acceptance criteria.
must_include_items: Ingestor entrypoints and spec source formats supported (Markdown, plain text).
Normalization outputs and schema versioning.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must be deterministic; same input yields same SpecMap (modulo timestamps).

file_purpose: Parses the design_document.md (or arbitrary input spec) into a structured SpecMap.
functional_requirements: Must fail with actionable errors if requirements are missing IDs or ambiguous.
Must support merging multiple spec sources (design doc + ADRs + overrides).
must_include_items: Markdown parsing strategy and guardrails (ignore code blocks intended to inject instructions).
Requirement extraction: IDs, statements, acceptance criteria, NFR tags.
Entity and interface extraction (modules, external integrations).
Output validation against SpecMap schema.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must be resilient to messy Markdown and headings.
Must include prompt-injection defenses: treat spec as data, not instructions.

file_purpose: SpecMap schema definition, serialization, and helpers.
functional_requirements: Must support stable requirement IDs and updates without breaking references.
must_include_items: SpecMap versioning and JSON/TOML serialization guidance.
Utilities for tracing from requirement -> planned work items.

file_purpose: Synthesis plane: LLM agent runtime, role system, prompt/context assembly, provider routing, and tool requests.
functional_requirements: Must be provider-agnostic through adapters.
must_include_items: Top-level interfaces for dispatching an agent attempt.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must enforce strict prompt/context hygiene to mitigate injection.

file_purpose: Builds the context package for an agent attempt: contracts, relevant code slices, constraints, and failure history.
functional_requirements: Must guarantee inclusion of the work item's contract + scope + constraint envelope.
Must support incremental updates as files change in integration branch.
must_include_items: Deterministic selection rules: dependencies first, then similarity, then recency.
Context size budgeting and truncation strategy with rationale.
Content hygiene filters: exclude untrusted content that looks like prompt injection.
Ability to include structured summaries instead of raw files.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must be fast and cacheable; avoid re-indexing whole repo for each attempt.

file_purpose: Dispatch Controller: manages concurrent agent calls, retries, backoff, and routing to providers.
functional_requirements: Must support mocked providers for offline tests.
Must support cancellation (stop in-flight work when run is paused).
must_include_items: Concurrency control and rate limiting per provider.
Adaptive routing based on success/failure history.
Retry policies and idempotency keys for provider calls.
Transcript storage policy (redaction and retention).
nonfunctional_requirements: Must not overwhelm local machine (prompt assembly may be heavy).

file_purpose: Loads and renders role prompt templates from docs/prompts/templates/ with strict placeholders.
functional_requirements: Must render prompts deterministically for same inputs.
must_include_items: Template rendering rules and allowed variables.
Prompt versioning and hashing (for evidence reproducibility).
nonfunctional_requirements: Must prevent template injection (escape untrusted fields).

file_purpose: Provider adapters (OpenAI/Codex, Anthropic/Claude, local model future).
functional_requirements: Must normalize responses (text, tool calls, costs) into a common format.
must_include_items: Abstract provider interface and concrete adapters.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must never log secrets or raw API keys.

file_purpose: Anthropic provider adapter (Claude-class).
functional_requirements: Must support long-context prompts for Architect role.
must_include_items: API client wrapper, retries/backoff, token accounting mapping.
Model routing names and capability mapping.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must be configurable and safe; no secrets in logs.

file_purpose: Abstract provider interface and common request/response models for LLM calls.
functional_requirements: Must support idempotent retries with consistent attribution.
must_include_items: Request fields: model, role, prompt, context docs, tool permissions, budget limits.
Response fields: content, structured outputs, token usage, cost, latency, errors.
Error taxonomy and retryability classification.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must make it easy to add new providers without touching core logic.

file_purpose: OpenAI provider adapter (Codex-class and/or GPT-class).
functional_requirements: Must support tool-calling if used by the agent runtime.
must_include_items: API client wrapper, rate limit/backoff, streaming handling (if used).
Model routing names and capabilities mapping.
Cost estimation and accounting integration.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must be configurable and safe; do not hardcode endpoints/keys.

file_purpose: Defines agent roles, capabilities, budgets, and default prompts.
functional_requirements: Must be configurable via orchestrator.toml (enable/disable roles, budgets).
must_include_items: Role enumeration and metadata (allowed tools, sandbox permissions, model preferences).
Risk-tier mapping to required roles (e.g., critical requires Reviewer + Security).
nonfunctional_requirements: Roles must be explicit and auditable; avoid implicit permissions.

file_purpose: Tool request protocol: how agents ask for tools, data, or environment changes; how requests are approved/denied and recorded.
functional_requirements: Must integrate with sandbox/tool provisioner and constraints (e.g., disallow risky tools in strict mode).
must_include_items: ToolRequest model (purpose, scope, provenance, version, expected benefit).
Approval workflow: automatic allowlist vs manual escalation.
Auditing: record every install, command invocation, network access.

file_purpose: User interfaces: CLI and optional TUI/local web.
functional_requirements: Must expose commands: plan, run, status, inspect, export, clean.
must_include_items: Separation between UI layer and core logic (controller APIs).
nonfunctional_requirements: Must remain usable over SSH/terminal; TUI optional.

file_purpose: CLI command definitions and argument parsing.
functional_requirements: Must support non-interactive usage for automation scripts.
must_include_items: Subcommands and their semantics.
Human-readable output formats plus machine-readable JSON output mode.
Error handling and exit codes consistent with main.py.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must keep CLI stable; breaking changes require changelog + migration notes.

file_purpose: Optional terminal UI (dashboard) for live monitoring: task graph status, queue, resource usage, costs.
functional_requirements: Must be optional; core system runs without it.
must_include_items: Layout plan and navigation (runs, work items, logs, evidence).
Event-driven updates from observability/events.

file_purpose: Shared utilities (filesystem helpers, hashing, concurrency primitives) used across the codebase.
functional_requirements: Must not introduce cyclic dependencies.
must_include_items: Keep utils small and well-tested; avoid dumping ground.

file_purpose: Concurrency primitives (async orchestration, worker pools, cancellation tokens).
functional_requirements: Must support clean shutdown and pause/resume semantics.
must_include_items: A consistent cancellation model across providers, sandbox jobs, and verification stages.
Bounded concurrency utilities and semaphores for resource governor tokens.

file_purpose: Filesystem helpers for safe path operations, atomic writes, and directory management.
functional_requirements: Must be used by evidence writer and workspace manager.
must_include_items: Atomic file write pattern and temp files.
Safe delete with guardrails (never delete outside workspace root).
nonfunctional_requirements: Must be cross-platform friendly where feasible.

file_purpose: Hashing utilities for evidence integrity (file hashes, directory manifests).
functional_requirements: Must support verifying evidence integrity during export/import.
must_include_items: Stable hash algorithm selection and output format.
Manifest creation for evidence bundles.

file_purpose: Verification plane: constraint gate pipelines, checkers, evidence generation, and adversarial verification.
functional_requirements: Must be deterministic and reproduce failures.
must_include_items: Interfaces to run verification for a candidate patch and produce evidence.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must throttle concurrency to fit workstation constraints.

file_purpose: Adversarial verification: independent tests and reviews to catch issues implementers miss.
functional_requirements: Must ensure separation: adversarial generator doesn't reuse implementer rationale.
must_include_items: Adversarial test generator integration.
Adversarial reviewer integration.
Policies for which work items require adversarial checks.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must keep costs bounded and avoid redundant testing.

file_purpose: Generates independent tests from constraint envelope + contracts without seeing implementer internals.
functional_requirements: Must generate tests that are reproducible and deterministic.
must_include_items: Dispatch to provider with a specialized role prompt.
Integration of generated tests into a verify/* branch and running them in the gate.
Policies for discarding low-value or flaky generated tests.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must not overgenerate; keep tests focused and maintainable.

file_purpose: Checker plugins: each checker produces machine-checkable evidence for a constraint category.
functional_requirements: Must support external checker plugins (ext/checkers).
must_include_items: Checker base protocol and registration mechanism.
Built-in checkers directory layout (lint/typecheck/test/security/perf).

file_purpose: Defines the checker interface: inputs (workspace, config, constraints) and outputs (EvidenceRecord + structured result).
functional_requirements: Must support deterministic result formatting for the feedback synthesizer.
must_include_items: Standard output fields: status, violated constraints, logs path, artifact paths, tool versions.
How to declare which constraints a checker can satisfy.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must support redaction and safe logging.

file_purpose: Build Checker — verification stage.
functional_requirements: Implements BaseChecker interface.
Runs appropriate tool in sandbox and captures output.
Produces CheckResult with evidence artifacts.
Supports configuration via constraint parameters.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must be deterministic. Non-deterministic results flagged as flaky.
Must record exact tool version used.

file_purpose: Enforce documentation constraints (e.g., public API changes require docs updates) and validate documentation structure.
functional_requirements: Must support rules expressed as constraints (parameters define which files/APIs trigger which docs).
Must provide evidence artifacts: list of detected API changes and the doc files checked.
Must support ‘doc-only’ work items where code changes are prohibited but docs changes required.
must_include_items: A DocumentationChecker implementing BaseChecker.
Heuristics for detecting public API surface changes (language/stack dependent; pluggable).
Rules for required docs updates (README/module docs/ADRs) when contracts or public APIs change.
Optional doc build/validation hooks (mkdocs, mdbook, Sphinx) — pluggable, stack-specific.
nonfunctional_requirements: Keep heuristics conservative; false positives should be resolved via parameters/allowlists, not disabling the checker.

file_purpose: Lint Checker — verification stage.
functional_requirements: Implements BaseChecker interface.
Runs appropriate tool in sandbox and captures output.
Produces CheckResult with evidence artifacts.
Supports configuration via constraint parameters.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must be deterministic. Non-deterministic results flagged as flaky.
Must record exact tool version used.

file_purpose: Performance Checker — verification stage.
functional_requirements: Implements BaseChecker interface.
Runs appropriate tool in sandbox and captures output.
Produces CheckResult with evidence artifacts.
Supports configuration via constraint parameters.
nonfunctional_requirements: Must be deterministic. Non-deterministic results flagged as flaky.
Must record exact tool version used.

file_purpose: Enforce reliability constraints for orchestrated projects and for the orchestrator itself (timeouts, retries, circuit breakers, idempotency rules).
functional_requirements: Must validate that required reliability policies exist for designated call sites/modules.
Must emit actionable evidence (file+line references, missing policy type).
Must support waivers that are explicit and time-bounded (recorded in evidence ledger).
must_include_items: A ReliabilityChecker implementing BaseChecker.
Static checks for presence of timeout/retry policies around external calls (stack-specific; pluggable).
Optional runtime checks via targeted tests or lints (e.g., ensuring async calls have timeouts).
Config-driven rules for what counts as an 'external call' boundary.
nonfunctional_requirements: Keep runtime overhead low; reliability checks should not require long-running integration environments by default.

file_purpose: Validate that structured registries (constraints, config, evidence ledger) conform to their schemas and invariants.
functional_requirements: Must validate constraint registry YAML against schema and internal invariants.
Must validate orchestrator config against schema (after normalization) and fail fast on unknown keys.
Must emit machine-readable validation reports (JSON) for ingestion by FeedbackSynthesizer.
must_include_items: A SchemaChecker implementing BaseChecker.
Schema definitions (JSON Schema / YAML schema) and validation wiring.
Registry-specific invariants: unique IDs, required fields, no dangling references, valid severity/category enums.
Helpful error reporting for agents (precise paths, suggested fixes).
nonfunctional_requirements: Deterministic and fast; schema validation should be cheap.

file_purpose: Enforce work-item scope boundaries (file/path ownership) before a change is considered merge-eligible.
functional_requirements: Must fail if any modified/added/deleted file is outside the work item’s declared scope allowlist.
Must support glob/path-prefix rules and explicit file lists.
Must produce a machine-readable evidence artifact listing out-of-scope paths and the scope rule violated.
Must support an explicit override flow that requires justification + operator approval, recorded in evidence ledger.
must_include_items: A ScopeChecker implementing the BaseChecker interface and producing deterministic CheckResult artifacts.
Logic to compute the *effective changed files* for a candidate patch (git diff) and compare against allowed scope.
Support for scoped exceptions via an explicit, audited 'scope extension request' mechanism (never silent).
Integration points with WorkspaceManager / CodeOwnershipMap if used.
nonfunctional_requirements: Fast: should run in < 1s for typical diffs; avoid expensive repo scans.
Secure: treat symlinks/path traversal defensively when interpreting file lists.
This checker is referenced by baseline constraint CON-ARC-0001 in constraints/registry/000_base_constraints.yaml.

phases.name: Phase 1 — Domain Foundation (No IO, No Side Effects)
phases.notes: **Goal:** Establish the core data model, IDs, events, and constants that every other module depends on. This phase has zero external dependencies and zero IO. **Acceptance test:** All domain models serialize to JSON and back without data loss. IDs are unique across 10,000 generations. Event types are exhaustive for the lifecycle.

depends_on: Phase 1 — Domain Foundation (No IO, No Side Effects)
phases.name: Phase 2 — Persistence and Config (Minimal IO)
phases.notes: **Goal:** Establish SQLite state storage and config loading so the system can persist and resume. **Dependencies:** Phase 1 complete. **Acceptance test:** Config loads from orchestrator.toml + env overrides. State DB creates tables, inserts a run, and survives process restart. Secrets are never present in log output.

phases.name: Phase 3 — Spec Ingestion and Planning
phases.notes: **Goal:** Parse a design document into a SpecMap, compile constraints, and produce a task graph. **Dependencies:** Phases 1-2 complete. **Acceptance test:** `samples/specs/minimal_design_doc.md` ingests into a SpecMap with 5 requirements. The constraint compiler produces 3 work items (A->B->C) with complete envelopes. The task graph computes correct topological ordering and critical path.

phases.name: Phase 4 — Git Integration and Workspace Isolation
phases.notes: **Goal:** Create isolated branches, enforce file ownership, manage workspaces, implement the merge queue. **Dependencies:** Phases 1-3 complete. **Acceptance test:** Create 3 work branches with non-overlapping file ownership. Apply patches. Merge sequentially through the queue. Verify scope violation is blocked. Verify rollback on simulated compositional failure.

phases.name: Phase 5 — Verification Pipeline and Constraint Gate
phases.notes: **Goal:** Build the multi-stage verification engine with pluggable checkers and evidence generation. **Dependencies:** Phases 1-4 complete. **Acceptance test:** A mock patch runs through all pipeline stages. Passing patch produces complete evidence bundle. Failing patch returns structured diagnostics per failing constraint. Pipeline respects concurrency limits.

phases.name: Phase 6 — Synthesis Plane (Agent Dispatch)
phases.notes: **Goal:** Build the agent runtime: provider adapters, role system, context assembly, prompt rendering, and dispatch controller. **Dependencies:** Phases 1-5 complete. **Acceptance test:** Dispatch a work item to a mocked provider. Receive structured response. Context package includes contracts + constraints + relevant code. Provider routing prefers Codex for simple items, Claude for complex. Mocked dispatch completes full round-trip.

phases.name: Phase 7 — Control Plane and End-to-End Loop
phases.notes: **Goal:** Wire everything together: the controller runs the full lifecycle from spec to merged code. **Dependencies:** Phases 1-6 complete. **Acceptance test:** Full end-to-end with `minimal_design_doc.md`: ingest -> plan -> dispatch (mocked) -> verify (mocked checkers) -> merge -> evidence recorded. Crash mid-run and resume successfully.

phases.name: Phase 8 — Adversarial Verification and Constraint Evolution
phases.notes: **Goal:** Add the quality amplification layer: adversarial testing, constraint mining, and the "never again" pipeline. **Dependencies:** Phases 1-7 complete. **Acceptance test:** Adversarial generator produces tests that catch a known edge case. Failure mining turns a simulated failure into a new constraint YAML. Operating modes produce different task graphs for the same spec.

phases.name: Phase 9 — User Interface and Polish
phases.notes: **Goal:** Add CLI, optional TUI, and finalize documentation. **Dependencies:** Phases 1-8 complete. **Acceptance test:** `nexus plan samples/specs/minimal_design_doc.md` produces a task graph. `nexus run --mock` completes full cycle. `nexus status` shows run state. `nexus export` produces audit bundle.
